titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 252
CWG12533

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder 1st INDEPENDENT BTRY LT. ARTY OFFICERS

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, May 25th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 252.
(Extract.)
26. Under the provisions of General Orders, No. 82, May 6th, 1865, from this Office, the following officers are hereby mustered out and honorably discharged the service of the United States, to take effect May 15th, 1865, on account of their services being no longer required, and physical disability, from wounds received in action. They will receive no final payments, until they have satisfied the Pay Department that they are not indebted to the Government: --
1st Lieutenant Arthur Erenburgh, 1st Kentucky Indepdendent Battery, Light Artillery.

The vacancies created by these discharges will not be filled.
By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

1' Indt Batty
Erenburgh Arthur
1 Lieut
Order
honorably discharging him from service --
vacancy not to be filled.
Entd
Recd A. G. O. May 31. 1865
